Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF) | Software Developer | Copenhagen, Denmark | ONSITE, VISA, SALARY:615k DKK http://www.gbif.org/

GBIF is an international organization and open-data research infrastructure, whose purpose is to make scientific biodiversity data available to all on the Internet.

In other words, like everyone else, we have cat pictures [1], but we also have a cat map [2], and we've started tracking when (and by whom) that data is cited [3].

We're looking for a software developer who will work on the systems behind GBIF.org: our data ingestion system, search indices, APIs, analytics, maps, configuration management, monitoring and so on. The source code for all this is on GitHub: https://github.com/gbif/. No biology knowledge is needed ­— the other developers have this, so strong development and Linux skills are much more important.

The starting salary is 51268 DKK per month (almost €6900/mth) and is exempt from Danish tax. Staff are recruited on the broadest possible geographical basis, so a visa is no problem at all.

For further information, and to apply by email: http://www.gbif.org/newsroom/news/gbif-seeks-software-develo...

[1] https://demo.gbif.org/occurrence/gallery?taxon_key=9703

[2] https://demo.gbif.org/species/9703

[3] https://demo.gbif.org/resource/search?q=Felidae&contentType=...
